pages.text: Osmiridium and iridosmine are natural alloys of the elements $(l:materials/Osmium)osmium$(/l) and $(l:materials/Iridium)iridium$(/l), with traces of other $(l:materials/Platinum)platinum$(/l)-group metals.$(p)Osmiridium has been defined as containing a higher proportion of $(l:materials/Iridium)iridium$(/l), with iridosmine containing more $(l:materials/Osmium)osmium$(/l). However, as the content of the natural Os-Ir alloys varies considerably, the constituent percentages of specimens often reflects the reverse situation of
osmiridium describing specimens containing a higher proportion of $(l:materials/Osmium)osmium$(/l) and iridosmine specimens containing more $(l:materials/Iridium)iridium$(/l).
